text: Northern Province (; ; ) is one of the five provinces of Rwanda. As of the 2022 census, 2,038,511 people lived there. It has an area of 3,276 kmÂ². The capital city is Byumba. It was created on 1 January 2006 from the former provinces of Ruhengeri and Byumba, along with northern parts of Kigali Rural. It has five districts of Burera, Gakenke, Gicumbi, Musanze, and Rulindo. Category:2006 establishments in Africa Category:Provinces of Rwanda
title: Northern Province, Rwanda
